meanings.definition: The care of children during the day by a person other than their parents.
meanings.sent1: At the daycare, children play and learn while their parents are at work.
meanings.sent2: I drop off my daughter at daycare before heading to the office.
meanings.sent3: The daycare was so full of energy, it felt like a mini carnival!
meanings.sent4: The daycare was a bustling hive of activity, with children buzzing around like busy bees.
meanings.sent5: The daycare workers provide a safe and nurturing environment for the kids.

meanings.definition: A facility where children are cared for during the day in a group setting.
meanings.sent1: The daycare has a playground where kids can have fun together.
meanings.sent2: Parents rely on daycare centers to take care of their children while they are at work.
meanings.sent3: The daycare room looked like a colorful jungle with all the toys scattered around.
meanings.sent4: The daycare functioned like a well-oiled machine, ensuring each child's needs were met.
meanings.sent5: The daycare's cheerful atmosphere makes it a favorite place for kids to spend their day.
